analytic.title: Corpus of Liturgical Books in the Modern Western Syrian Tradition (on the Example of Mar Afram Monastery)

biblStruct.note: The article offers a representative review of the liturgical tradition of the Mar Afram monastery (Syria), one of the modern spiritual and educational centers of the Syro-Jacobites (Syrian Christian pre-Chalcedonites), fixed in liturgical books. The main sources for the report are materials collected by the author as part of a field expedition in 2020. A variant of the classification of monuments of liturgical writing currently used for worship is presented. If necessary, comparative parallels with the Byzantine rite are drawn. Th e article concludes with review of aspects for further study of the West Syriac written tradition in synchronic and diachronic analysis.
